body:
Hi @CreativeTechGuy, thanks for the issue!

> ```js
> console.log(Math.PI * 1/4)
> ```

I think the rule works as intended because this is technically `(Math.PI * 1) / 4`.

> I'd like a special case/exception made to the rule's checks that if the ` * 1` is immediately followed by a `/` then it is not an error.

You could add parentheses around the expression that should logically be an operand of `*` to make it become an actual operand of `*`. In the original example, the expression would be `Math.PI * (1/4)`. Here's a [playground demo](https://eslint.org/play/#eyJ0ZXh0IjoiY29uc29sZS5sb2coTWF0aC5QSSAqICgxLzQpKSAvLyBubyBlcnJvciIsIm9wdGlvbnMiOnsicGFyc2VyT3B0aW9ucyI6eyJlY21hVmVyc2lvbiI6ImxhdGVzdCIsInNvdXJjZVR5cGUiOiJzY3JpcHQiLCJlY21hRmVhdHVyZXMiOnt9fSwicnVsZXMiOnsibm8taW1wbGljaXQtY29lcmNpb24iOlsiZXJyb3IiXX0sImVudiI6eyJlczYiOnRydWV9fX0=) where the rule does not report implicit coercion. I'm not in favor of adding the proposed exception but curious what other team members think about it.

Hi @mdjermanovic! Thanks for the reply. I know it can be worked around, but I've been running into this so often lately when doing math that it seemed like it could be improved. It seems like always a false positive since I cannot think of a case where the `* 1 /` pattern is used and the intent is to coerce the number rather than multiply by a fraction. I guess I'm saying it shouldn't hurt and can make the rule a little smarter. :)

If it would tip the scales, I'd be willing to submit the PR to add this.

> It seems like always a false positive since I cannot think of a case where the `* 1 /` pattern is used and the intent is to coerce the number rather than multiply by a fraction

That's a good point, as `/` coerces its operands to numbers anyway. I'm not opposed to adding this exception (by default, no option) and treating this as a bug fix, but let's hear from the rest of the team first.
I'm also not opposed to treat it as a bugfix üëçüèª

issue.title: fix: allow `* 1` when followed by `/` in no-implicit-coercion

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

A minimal change in `no-implicit-coercion` behavior to allow special case described in #16373:

> I'd like a special case/exception made to the rule's checks that if the * 1 is immediately followed by a / then it is not an error.

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?
